Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Initial Appearance as to Wayne Vargas-De-Jesus, Santos A. Pacheco-Borrero, Victor R. Cruz-Quinones held on 5/8/2008. Present were AUSA Jose Capo, AUSA Myriam Fernandez and PTO Shakira Botello. Defendants were provided with copy of the indictment and advised as to their rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 forms filled by defendants, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Each defendant will be represented by an individual member of the CJA Panel. Arraignment and Detention hearings set for 5/13/2008 at 09:00 AM before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. Defendants are ordered detained pending hearing. (yr) (Entered: 05/13/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment as to Wayne Vargas-De-Jesus (3) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6,7 held on 5/13/2008. Present were AUSA Jose Capo, AUSA Myriam Fernandez, Ms. Laura Maldonado and court interpreter Felix Toledo. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. Defendant waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motion. Case is referred to Judge Delgado for trial scheduling. (Court Reporter FTR.) (yr) (Entered: 05/14/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Detention Hearing as to Wayne Vargas-De-Jesus held on 5/13/2008. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Detention Hearing as to Edward Algarin-Ruiz held on 5/13/2008. Present were AUSA Jose Capo, AUSA Myriam Fernandez, Mr. Artemio Rivera, PTO A. Meaux and court interpreter Felix Toledo. Arguments heard as to bail for this defendant. Mr. Rivera informed that defendant was willing to go to an in-patient drug rehabilitation program. The Court adopted the recommendations made by PT and set bail in the amount of $10,000.00 cash or secured, in-patient drug treatment, plus all other standard conditions of release. (Court Reporter FTR.) (yr) (Entered: 05/14/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Detention Hearing as to Jonathan Torres-Echevarria held on 5/13/2008. The Court set bail in the amount of $25,000.00 cash or secured, home incarceration with EM, live outside of Ferran Ward, have no contact with any of the other co-defendants, U/A and treatment if deemed necessary by PT, plus all other standard conditions of release. (Court Reporter FTR.) (yr) (Entered: 05/14/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Detention Hearing as to Jose L. Gonzalez-Matos held on 5/13/2008. Bail was set in $15,000.00 of which $5,000.00 are to be cash or secured and $10,000.00 unsecured, home detention with EM, employment, live outside of Ferran Ward and refrain from entering the ward, plus standard conditions of release. Defense counsel informs that her client will exercise his right to go to trial and that he specifically requests a Bench Trial. Counsel informs that she will not be using the expert requested in her Ex-Parte Motion. Court addresses the defendant, who is being assisted by counsel and the Court Interpreter, and the request for Bench Trial is DENIED. Government's counsel, AUSA Myriam Fernandez, informs that the plea offer remains in place until today and that after today no other plea agreement will be forthcoming. ORDER as to Luis A. Torres-Ruiz re 469 Response in Opposition filed by Luis A. Torres-Ruiz. DENIED. Counsel is reminded the Court is not bound by stipulations within a Plea Agreement nor by the Plea Agreement. If CJA practice generates problems for counsel, he may elect to do otherwise and limit his practice to private practice. Counsel raising the issues herein raised (CJA) is totally improper and will be discussed before CJA Committee. Counsel should be aware, and if not, seek the advise of more experienced attorneys, that the U.S.P.O. has a duty to investigate and submit an independent evaluation of all sentencing factors. Counsel is placed on notice that future similar motions will subject him to sanctions. Actually, this motion as meritless and unsounded, will not be paid from CJA funds. CJA Specialist to be placed on notice. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 12/17/2008.(wm) (Entered: 12/17/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Sentencing held on 1/12/2009 for Edward Algarin-Ruiz (10), Count(s) 1. Court reviewed the PSR and the motion for variance filed by the defense, as well as the information regarding the defendant's juvnenile record which was provided by the US Probation Officer. Objections/clarifications regarding the PSR are discussed on the record, and the PSR is to be amended accordingly. Based on government's proffer, the Court will not warrant the three (3) point enhancement due to the defendant's role. Defendant's allocution heard. Term of imprisonment: 97 months. SRT of 8 years. No fine. SMA of $100.00.; Count(s) 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, Dismissed. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)(Court Interpreter Edna Brayfield.) Hearing set for 2:00 p.m. Hearing held at 2:16 p.m. Hearing ended at 2:50 p.m. (sr) Present: AUSA Myriam Fernandez and defense counsel Artemio Rivera- Rivera. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Merangelie Serrano also present. (Entered: 01/13/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Further Status Conference as to Richard De-Jesus-Soler, Jose L. Gonzalez-Matos held on 8/3/2009. Government's counsel informs that the case as to Gonzalez Matos will be disposed of by means of an Information. As to Richard de Jesus, the parties are still in plea negotiations. Attorney Rodriguez informs that he'll meet with his client to discuss the information. As to co-defendant Richard De Jesus, he states that attorney Masini is in the process of making arrangements to have Dr. Romey interview defendant's brother Alexis De Jesus (defendant #8) and their parents. After hearing the parties, the Court sets a Final Status Conference for 8/13/2009 at 3:00 PM in Courtroom 1 before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. Once Information is filed, attorney Rodriguez is to file motion for change of plea. If necessary, attorney Masini is to file a proposed order to enable Dr. Romey to carry out her interview of Alexis De Jesus (8) who is under custody at MDC-Guaynabo. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Further Status Conference as to Richard De-Jesus-Soler, Jose L. Gonzalez-Matos held on 8/12/2009. Government's counsel informs that the case as to Jose L. Gonzalez Matos shall be disposed of by means of an Information. A draft of the waiver of indictment, information and plea agreement has been provided to counsel for his client's consideration. As to defendant Richard de Jesus, the parties are further apart in plea negotiations but still engage in the same. The government understands that a mental evaluation report is yet to be rendered and the government would like to review the same to ascertain wether it will affect plea negotiations. The Court : The minutes shall reflect as to defendant Richard De-Jesus-Soler that plea negotiations are still on going, however they have reached an impasse. Once the mental evaluation report is filed the parties shall review the same and revisit plea negotiations. Attorney Masini stated for the record that his client requested him to convey to the Court that he is willing accept a plea agreement of 60 months. Noted. The minutes shall reflect as to defendant Jose L. Gonzalez-Matos the parties believe that the matter shall be resolved by the filing of an information and that a draft of that information and the plea agreement are being reviewed by the defense. Waiver of Indictment Motion as to defendant Jose L. Gonzalez-Matos due by 8/21/2009. (Court Reporter FTR.) Present: AUSA- Myriam Fernandez, attys. Juan Masini, Benito Rodriguez. Torres Ruiz is modified in accordance with the provisions of 18 U.S.C. 3582(c)(2) and U.S.S.G. 1B1.10(c), Amendment 706 of the United States Sentencing Commission Guidelines. Luis A. Torres Ruiz was sentenced on March 12, 2009 to 97 months of imprisonment as to Count 1 of the  indictment. (Docket No. 604.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Richard De-Jesus-Soler (5) held on 6/8/2016. Present: AUSA Cesar Rivera and AFPD Jesus Hernandez. USPO Alejandro Martinez-Coss also present. Defendant U/C, present in court and assisted by the certified Court Interpreter. Defendant informed his intention to proceed with the full revocation hearing. The testimony of Government's witness, USPO Alejandro Martinez- Coss was heard. Statements in support of mitigation were also heard. After hearing the parties, the testimony of the USPO and defendant's allocution, the Court found that defendant violated the conditions of supervised release imposed on June 2, 2010 and, therefore, he was REVOKED. IMPR.: Three (3) months; SRT: Seven (7) years under the same terms imposed on 6/2/2010 plus two additional conditions: participation in the Moral Recognition Therapy Group and no less than 600 hours of community work when not employed full-time. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 10:19.Hearing ended at 11:28.Interpreter Felix Toledo. (grf) (Entered: 06/08/2016)

JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Richard De-Jesus-Soler (5), IMPR.: Three (3) months; SRT: Seven (7) years. All other conditions imposed on 6/2/2010 shall remain in effect. Signed by Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 6/8/2016.(grf) (Entered: 06/08/2016)

Present: AUSA Edward Veronda, AFPD Isabelle Oria, and USPO Alejandro Martinez. Defendant is under custody, present in court and assisted by the court interpreter. Testimony of USPO Alejandro Martinez heard on behalf of the Government. Cross- examination conducted. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Hector M. Segarra-Ortiz (17) held on 4/3/2017. Present: AUSA Nicholas Cannon and AFPD Isabelle Oria. Defendant present, under the conditions of supervised release, and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Alejandro Martinez also present. Counsel for defendant informed that the violation will not be contested. Proceeds by proffer for purposes of mitigation. No allocution by defendant. Based on AFPD Oria's proffer, USPO Alejandro Martinez clarified that the defendant has not actively sought employment, instead minimum efforts have been made and despite affording him opportunities to study and complete his GED and secure employment he has not made efforts to comply. Also defendant owes over $9,000 in child support payments. Defendant clarified he made the last 3 payments towards his child support. After reviewing the case and defendant's poor adjustment, the defendant is revoked. IMPR of 6 months. SRT of 6 years. Defendant is remanded to the custody of the US Marshals. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 2:00 p.m. Hearing held at 2:27 p.m. Hearing ended at 2:55 p.m. Interpreter Heidi Cazes. (sr) (Entered: 04/03/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Edward Algarin-Ruiz (10) held on 5/30/2017. AUSA Laura Montes and AFPD John Connors were present. Defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defense counsel informed that defendant will not contest the allegations made in the motion filed by the U.S. Probation Officer and based on the violations charged which is the commission to the new offense in Cr. 16-466 (GAG) have requested a sentence to the higher end of the guideline of 16 months. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution was heard. The Government requested a sentence at the upper end of 18 months and be sentenced to the other sentence in Cr. 16- 466 (GAG). Based on the Ist Circuit case law, the Court can not impose a consecutive sentence to that of another federal case pending sentence, but can do so with a state court case. After having heard the parties, the Court finds that defendant violated the conditions of the imposed supervised release term. The Court imposed sentence to an imprisonment term of 36 months (time served to be credited since July 13, 2016), with no supervision to follow. All terms are specified in the judgment form. The defendant was advised of his right to appeal. The matter of consecutive or concurrent sentence will be left to the sound discretion of Judge Gelpi at sentencing in Cr. 16-466 (GAG). Defense counsel objected to the sentence imposed. The Court stood by the findings  made on the record. (USPO Alejandro Martinez.) (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 03:00. Hearing held at 04:05. Hearing ended at 04:28. Interpreter Enith Valdes. (br) (Entered: 06/01/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release and Show Cause Hearing as to Joel Pagan (18) held via VTC on 9/3/2020. Present were AUSA Sean Murphy, AFPD John Connors and USPO Mariela Fernandez. The defendant was under conditions of supervised release, present via video and assisted by the court interpreter. The defendant was advised of 1417 Motion Notifying Violations to the Supervised Release Term filed by USPO Fernandez and as to his right to a final revocation hearing before the Presiding Judge. Defense counsel requested the Court to allow the defendant to continue under the same conditions of supervised release pending the final revocation hearing so that he may receive the mental health treatment and medication that he needs to effectively comply with the conditions of release. The Government requested that a final revocation be held. USPO Fernandez informed the Court that a Supplemental Motion will be filed. The Court found that a Final Revocation hearing was warranted therefore the case was referred to Judge Aida Delgado Colon for the scheduling of the same. The defendant shall remain under the same conditions of supervised release pending further proceedings. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa.) Hearing set for 4:00 PM. Hearing held at 3:55 PM. Hearing ended at 4:07 PM. Interpreter Carlos Ravelo. (cmd) (Entered: 09/03/2020)
